qa.name: Ethan
qa.appearance: Translucent with a faint blue glow
qa.character_age: Appears to be in his late 20s

json_to_edit.voice_over: In the silence of eternity, I wandered, searching for meaning.
json_to_edit.description: Ethan, a lonely ghost, floats through various locations, contemplating his existence.
json_to_edit.location: Various locations in a small town
json_to_edit.name: Ethereal Journey
json_to_edit.scene_summary: A ghost named Ethan explores different places in town, seeking his purpose in the afterlife.

qa.action: Ethan floating above the misty town square, observing the oblivious living below.

hf.action: Ethan passes through the walls of an old library, his hands brushing incorporeally over book spines.

tr.action: Ethan's translucent face, eyes filled with longing as he watches a family dinner through a window.

xc.action: Camera follows Ethan as he drifts through a park, passing through trees and benches.

ka.action: Ethan floating up towards the ceiling of an empty church, bathed in moonlight from stained glass windows.

fn.action: Through Ethan's eyes, we see a lively bar, patrons unaware of his presence as he moves among them.

af.action: Ethan's ethereal hand trying to touch a vintage pocket watch in an antique shop, passing right through it.

qo.action: Ethan hovering over the surface of a moonlit lake, his reflection rippling in the water below.

fp.action: Ethan sitting on a swing in an empty playground, gently swaying without touching the ground.

va.action: Ethan floating high above the town, a solitary, glowing figure against the night sky, contemplating his journey.

edit_command: Add a new establishing shot before each existing shot, showing the location Ethan is about to enter. Don't change anything else in the scene.

label.rationale: we will add new establishing shots before each existing shot to show the location ethan is about to enter. this will provide context for each scene and enhance the visual storytelling. we'll keep the original shots intact and add new ones, effectively doubling the number of shots in the scene. we'll update the "number_of_shots" field and add new entries to the "shots" dictionary, adjusting the "list_display_order" accordingly.
